itemDescription: British Anglican priest, poet and LGBT activist

wikipedia_page.main: Rachel Mann (born 1970) is a British Anglican priest, poet and feminist theologian. She is a trans woman who writes, speaks and broadcasts on a wide range of topics including gender, sexuality and religion.

response: * Rachel Mann – priest, poet and broadcaster
* Rachel Mann, Priest, Poet and Theologian
* February 27 – Rachel Mann, English trans woman poet and Anglican priest
The theme of the Lent Talks for 2020 was identity. It began with a talk by Rachel Mann, who talked about how if we think of Jesus as the Son of God, we think of him as barely human.
*Rachel Mann (2008 to present); rector of the parish

link_mentions.page: Faith and Order Commission (Church of England)

response: He broadcast a reflection on Open Table as part of a BBC Radio 4 service led by Rachel Mann in September 2020.

Starting November 2020, new patrons of the Open Table Network introduced themselves on webinars. The new patrons are: Rachel Mann, John Bradbury, Bishop Cherry Vann, Pádraig Ó Tuama, Bishop Paul Bayes, John L. Bell, and Barbara Glasson.

link_mentions.page: History of transgender people in the United Kingdom
response: *2005 - Rachel Mann is ordained as deacon in the Anglican Church
